places.name: Technikum Mittweida
places.description: Main building of Mittweida University (Carl‑Georg‑Weitzel‑Building), historically and technically significant.

places.name: Mittweida Castle
places.shortDescription: Majestic castle with a rich history and scenic views.
descriptionParagraphs: Mittweida Castle is a gem of Saxony’s architectural heritage, majestically situated above the Zschopau river. Originally built as a noble residence, it has witnessed centuries of regional transformation.

Today, its walls serve not only as a historical reminder but also as a venue for exhibitions, events, and celebrations. Visitors enjoy panoramic views, cultural programming, and a unique blend of tradition and modernity.

places.name: Town Church of Our Lady
places.description: Medieval church with a 54 m tower and 360° view over Mittweida’s old town.

places.name: Johannes Schilling House
places.description: Birthplace of sculptor Johannes Schilling, now an art history museum.

places.name: Mittweida Old Town
places.description: Narrow streets with restored residential and artisan houses – ideal for strolling.

places.name: Mittweida Water Tower
places.description: Renovated brick structure, a visible landmark of the city.

places.name: Schwanenteich Park
places.description: Idyllic park with a pond, walking paths, and a small animal area.

places.name: Mittweida Outdoor Pool
places.description: Summer open-air pool with swimming areas and family-friendly facilities.

places.name: Mittweida Train Station
places.description: Regional station operating since 1852, an important hub for commuters.

places.name: Old Vicarage Museum
places.description: Museum showcasing Mittweida’s urban, craft, and industrial culture.

places.name: Mittweida Market Square
places.description: Central square with weekly markets, a fountain, and half-timbered buildings.

places.name: Space Flight Museum
places.description: Special museum with exhibitions on space travel and technology.
